kindred.view.cli

Class CLI

  • Object
    • kindred.view.AbstractView
      • kindred.view.cli.CLI

  • public class CLI
extends AbstractView
    Provides a command-line user interface (CLI) to interact with the user through a terminal.
    Author:
    Kindred Team

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Atom[][] atomMap
      A map of Atoms representing the tiles of the map.
      private String colourFile
      Name of the file containing the background colours of the Terrains.
      private HashMap<String,Colour> colourTypes
      Maps names of Terrains to their corresponding background colours.
      private Scanner scanner
      The scanner object to get user's input from the command-line interface.
      private String symbolFile
      Name of the file containing the symbols for each Unit.
      private HashMap<String,Character> symbolTypes
      Maps names of Units to their corresponding Character symbol.

      • parsePosition

        private int[] parsePosition(String[] separate)
        Parses an array of strings containing numbers, except for the first element, which is supposedly a command (ignored by this method). As the numbers represent positions (row, column), there must be an even quantity of numbers. This method also checks if the position is valid (i.e., is inside the bounds of the map)
        Parameters:
        separate - an array of strings containing anything in the first position and an even quantity of numbers in the rest of it
        Returns:
        an array of ints representing the positions given in the strings of separate, or null in case of errors

      • printPrompt

        private static void printPrompt()
        Displays a prompt message to the user.

      • printFileContent

        private boolean printFileContent(String filename)
        Reads and prints content of the specified file.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file to be printed to the user
        Returns:
        true if successful, or false otherwise

      • gameStartedMessage

        private String gameStartedMessage(String argument)
        Returns a message telling the user that the game has started.
        Parameters:
        argument - pipe-separated String containing the opponent's name, the user's team identifier (1 or 2) and the map name
        Returns:
        the String to be printed
